Key Match Events: The Yankees won Game 4 of the ALCS with an 8-6 victory
Alex Verdugo drove in the go-ahead run with a weak grounder to shortstop that Cleveland Guardians shortstop Brayan Rocchio couldn’t field cleanly in the ninth inning
Gleyber Torres followed with a single to center field to drive in Anthony Volpe and boost the Yankees’ lead
Post-Match Reflections: The Guardians face a must-win on Saturday at home
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cade Smith was Cleveland’s fourth pitcher of the game and came into Friday’s matchup having allowed just one run in nine postseason innings. He had a disastrous result in Game 4
Juan Soto and Wells also hit home runs in Game 4, roughing up Guardians starter Gavin Williams in the top of the first and second
Others: Tanner Bibee will start Game 5 with the Guardians' season at stake
Carlos Rodon gets the starting nod for the Yankees on Saturday, with first pitch scheduled for 8:08 p.m. ET
